I am not an inferior-PID. In 2030 China will be the world economic power (McCoy UW). USA will be secondary pid. item.title: Guru Meditation VB - 37 ver not supported
item.dc:creator: @S76G6
item.description:
I looked up site:virtualbox.org for more information on this error message and all I could find was a ticket from several years ago about windows. My host is Fedora because Debian and Qubes are not fully hardware compatible with Intel Alder Lake.
. .
00:00:00.928482 Changing the VM state from ‘RUNNING’ to ‘GURU_MEDITATION’
00:00:00.928486 Console: Machine state changed to ‘Stuck’
00:00:00.928996 !!!
00:00:00.928997 !!
00:00:00.928997 !! VCPU0: Guru Meditation -37 (VERR_NOT_SUPPORTED)
00:00:00.929004 !!
00:00:00.929012 !!
00:00:00.929013 !! {mappings, }
00:00:00.929013 !!
00:00:00.929018 !!
00:00:00.929018 !! {hma, }
00:00:00.929019 !!
00:00:00.929019 !!
00:00:00.929020 !! {cpumguest, verbose}
00:00:00.929020 !!
. . .

Sometimes VirtualBox works perfectly, and then–spontaneously–it does not and says Guru Meditation is required. Oracle will not allow me to sign up for an account. I do not know why. If someone* can get a support request link or knows the answer, do so or please tell.

(zip attached gzip - what part of the rest of the log is important?) . . . nope, forum doesn’t allow zip format

  • [footnote] I get cyber attacked because there is a cover up to claim I was not intelligent enough to reproduce, but this is not true. The Navy InfoWars Joint Spectrum Warfare and Google corporate espionage KC smoke dope. I do not.

item.title: Is Kicksecure right for me?
item.dc:creator: @moar.secur
item.description:
Greetings Kicksecure Community!

I am an individual who is currently looking for a security-hardened desktop experience for Debian. I am setting this up for a Windows user (my family member). The same setup I give them will be the same setup I’ll use on my Debian laptop so I can “look over their shoulder” for any problems they might experience.

I have a few questions for the community.

1.) Can I install Kicksecure on a Debian-based distro like SpiralLinux? Please Google. Can’t link website.
2.) Would it drastically change the settings setup by SpiralLinux?
3.) Regardless of SpiralLinux, can my family member still use Firefox and Brave comfortably and print stuff off of their wireless Brother printer? They really need Bluetooth and Printing to work, or this whole thing collapses.
4.) This security sounds great, but is it “beginner friendly” to maintain? I still have a life to live. I’d like to “set it and forget it” if possible.

Here are my needs:

1.) A Debian distro with Btrfs+Snapper/Timeshift support.
2.) Full nonfree hardware support.
3.) Extensive printer support.
4.) Full Bluetooth support.
5.) Comfortable web browsing experience.

Nice to Have:
1.) Messaging services like Signal, Telegram, and WhatsApp on the desktop.

I have used Linux for a long time, but mostly stuck with Ubuntu and EndeavourOS. I am a Linux novice when it comes to security, but I am willing to read documentation and learn. Can you help me? Is Kicksecure right for me and my family?

item.title: Kicksecure 16.0.9.8 - for VirtualBox - Point Release!
item.dc:creator: @Patrick
item.description:
Kicksecure for VirtualBox

Download Kicksecure for VirtualBox:

Kicksecure – 1 Nov 22

Kicksecure ™ for Windows, MacOS, Linux inside VirtualBox

Kicksecure ™ for VirtualBox - Stable Version

This is a point release.

Kicksecure – 7 Mar 23

Point Release

What is a Point Release?

Major Changes

  • ram-wipe - Wipe RAM on shutdown and reboot has been developed. (But not yet installed by default because there is no ISO yet.)
  • zsh configuration enhancements (Thanks to @nyxnor.)
  • updates LKRG in the repository

Upgrade

Alternatively, in-place release upgrade is possible upgrade using Kicksecure repository.

This release would not have been possible without the numerous supporters of Kicksecure!

Please Donate!

Kicksecure – 4 Mar 23

Donating to Kicksecure ™

PayPal, Bitcoin (BTC), Monero (XMR), Ethereum (ETH) or Token, Credit Card, Bank Wire, Others

Please Contribute!

Kicksecure – 2 Mar 23

Contribute to Kicksecure

Spread, Follow, Develop, Testing, Donate. Contribute to Freedom Software / Open Source.

Changelog

Kicksecure – 17 Mar 23

Changelog

Kicksecure ™ Release Notes, Changelog

Full difference of all changes

item.title: Kicksecure no screen lock installed
item.dc:creator: @webaka9
item.description: Screen lock is only present when user is logged out, but it expected to be available when try to lock screen too.

item.title: Kicksecure no screen lock installed
item.dc:creator: @webaka9
item.description:
Morphed Debian into Kicksecure xfce. All went good, but no screen lock available, only Log out. xflock4 does nothing, “xfce4-screensaver-command --lock” - command not found.
What should I install to fix it?
Thanks.

item.title: Installation problem
item.dc:creator: @bikerjaytn
item.description:
the problem is when trying to install Kicksecure. I’ve posted the same thing in that forum but no response yet. See below:

i keep getting the following error when trying to install whonix for virtualbox. anybody help me out with this. Obviously, its not connecting to Tor but i’m trying to figure out why it would be trying to if it hasnt installed the necessary files to connect to Tor. I’m a Linux noob if you havent picked up on that yet.
I guess i should note that im installing on a Fedora KDE host

Failed to fetch tor+http://deb.w5j6stm77zs6652pgsij4awcjeel3eco7kvipheu6mtr623eyyehj4yd.onion/dists/bullseye/InRelease Could not connect to 127.0.0.1:9050 (127.0.0.1). - connect (111: Connection refused)

item.title: Cannot use split-u2f (yubikey website authentication)
item.dc:creator: @udyv301
item.description:
Still made zero progress on this.

Could something in security-misc prevent qubes-u2f policies from working correctly?

Or maybe it’s preventing the browser from accessing it?

The yubikey is never actually attached to the dispvm and is instead attached to sys-usb, which uses a template based on kicksecure. And just to be very specific, everything works fine with firefox in normal debian-minimal dispvm.

Please advise, I really need this to work, any help welcome!
